def.dt: :in the middle of something :located in the center of a thing or place The country is in central Africa. [=the area that is in the middle of Africa] The house has four rooms and a central chimney. City planners are looking for a central location for the new hospital.

:main or most important The novel's central [=main] character is an orphan. The professor has become a central [=key] figure in the controversy. The evidence was central to the defense's case. a central belief/claim

:controlling all other parts :having power over the other parts The country's schools are financed by both local and central governments. The central authority of the company's board is being challenged.
:designed to reach all parts of a building The apartment has both central air-conditioning and central heating.

utxt.vi: We should emphasize the centrality of this evidence to our case.
The new hospital will be centrally located.

def.dt: :a place where an activity takes place or a group meets :a place that is a center for an activity or group The resort is party central for college students on spring break. [=college students on spring break have many parties at the resort] Our family room becomes kid central on weekends.
:a bank that does business with other banks and with the government and that controls a country's money supply and interest rates

:the department at a movie company that chooses which actor will play each part Someone who is said to be from/out of central casting is a person whose appearance, behavior, or nature seem to be typical for their job or position. The physics professor looks like he's right out of central casting: his white hair is disheveled, his suit rumpled, and he looks a little lost.
:the center part of a large city The central city is losing population, while the suburbs are expanding.
:an electronic system that locks all the doors of a car at the same time
:the part of the nervous system that includes the brain and spinal cord
